emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Urban Planning
emerging_technologies.description: Use of AI to optimize urban layout, traffic flow, and resource allocation.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could lead to more efficient cities but might also raise privacy concerns due to extensive data collection.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption depends on governmental policies, public trust in AI, and the development of non-invasive data collection methods.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum-Resistant Cryptography
emerging_technologies.description: Development of cryptographic systems that are resistant to quantum computing attacks.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Ensures continued security in digital transactions and data protection against future quantum threats.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires significant investment in research, but adoption will be driven by the need for security in the face of advancing quantum computing capabilities.

emerging_technologies.name: Neuromorphic Computing
emerging_technologies.description: Computing systems inspired by the structure and function of biological neural networks.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could revolutionize AI by mimicking human brain efficiency, potentially leading to ethical debates about AI consciousness.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption will hinge on breakthroughs in material science and the ability to scale these systems effectively.

emerging_technologies.name: In-Orbit Manufacturing
emerging_technologies.description: Manufacturing of components and structures in space, reducing the cost and complexity of space missions.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Promotes space exploration and colonization but requires addressing space debris and international space law.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption will be driven by space agencies and private space companies looking to reduce launch costs and increase mission flexibility.

emerging_technologies.name: Solid-State Batteries
emerging_technologies.description: Batteries with solid electrolytes, offering higher energy densities, faster charging, and improved safety.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces dependency on fossil fuels, enhances electric vehicle adoption, but must address manufacturing costs and recycling issues.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption will be rapid due to the automotive industry's push towards electric vehicles.

mainstream_technologies.name: Level 4 Autonomous Vehicles
mainstream_technologies.description: Vehicles capable of operating without human intervention in most conditions.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread in urban areas with suitable infrastructure; regulatory and public acceptance challenges persist.

epoch_themes.description: Focus on technologies that support environmentally sustainable lifestyles and economies.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Encourages a shift towards renewable energy sources and more efficient urban living, potentially reducing carbon footprints.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased environmental consciousness, government policies favoring green technologies, and a push towards zero-emission targets.

epoch_themes.description: Enhancing security and trust in digital systems amidst growing cyber threats.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Ensures secure transactions, privacy, and data integrity in an increasingly digital world.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Rising cybercrime rates, regulatory demands for data protection, and the expansion of digital economies.
